metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3735 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
While parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X.509 certificate, it is possible to do a one-byte overread. This would result in an incorrect text display of the certificate. This bug has been present since 2006 and is present in all versions of OpenSSL before 1.0.2m and 1.1.0g.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.23
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.23').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
